text:
Is is correct, that if I have some code of the form
```Threads.@threads for i in 1:20
   # do something
end```
then Julia will just split 1:20 into equal sized pieces and not take into consideration that not each value might have the same runtime?

elements.text: Is is correct, that if I have some code of the form

Threads.@threads for i in 1:20
   # do something
end
then Julia will just split 1:20 into equal sized pieces and not take into consideration that not each value might have the same runtime?

text: Yes, it will split like 1:4 for thread 1 5:9 for 2 etc

elements.text: Yes, it will split like 1:4 for thread 1 5:9 for 2 etc

text: I should have expected that... I guess the good news it then that there is still more potential to make my code faster

text: If you need different load balancing I recommend using `Threads.@spawn` directly

text: I am calculating the entries for a symmetric matrix, so I think by calculating the indices directly I will probably have a slightly lower overhead - but I guess I should also benchmark with `Threads.@spawn`
